sense.name: basis
sense.commentary: criterion, measure, ideal, touchstone - a basis for comparison; a reference point against which other things can be evaluated
sense.examples: They set the measure for all subsequent work. They live by the standards of their community.

sense.name: monetary standard
sense.commentary: the value behind the money in a monetary system
sense.examples: The gold standard is a monetary standard under which the basic unit of currency is defined by a stated quantity of gold.

sense.name: pole
sense.commentary: an upright pole or beam (especially one used as a support)
sense.examples: Distance was marked by standards every mile. Lamps supported on standards provided illumination.

sense.name: a board measure
sense.examples: The distance between Montreal and NYC is several hundred standards.

sense.name: distinctive flag
sense.examples: An oriflame is a red or orange-red flag used as a standard by early French kings.

sense.name: standard item
sense.examples: Your car comes equipped with all the standards; air conditioning, power brakes, etc.
